name: count
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say numbers one after the other in order, or to calculate the number of people or things in a group

example.eg: Let's count out loud (= speak the words) from one to ten.
example.egtrans: 我们来大声地从1数到10。

example.eg: The teachers counted the students as they got on to the bus.
example.egtrans: 学生们上车时老师点了一下人数。

example.eg: Count your money carefully to make sure it's all there.
example.egtrans: 好好数数你的钱，看看是不是都在。

example.eg: We need to count who's here, so we can make sure that no one's missing.
example.egtrans: 我们要点一下谁在这儿，以确定无人缺席。

example.eg: There'll be eight for dinner, counting (= including) ourselves.
example.egtrans: 算上我们自己，共有8人就餐。

example.eg: We're still waiting for the votes to be counted (up).
example.egtrans: 我们仍在等待统计选票。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to count the number of people present somewhere

example.eg: There look to be about 50 people here - I haven't counted heads yet.
example.egtrans: 看起来大概有50人在场——我还没有清点人数。

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: I've always believed that happiness counts more than money.
example.egtrans: 我一直认为幸福比金钱更重要。

example.eg: My opinion doesn't count for anything around here (= no one values my opinion).
example.egtrans: 我的看法在这儿丝毫不受重视。

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to consider or be considered as

example.eg: I count myself fortunate to have had such a good education.
example.egtrans: 能受到如此良好的教育我认为自己很幸运。

example.eg: I've had three jobs in the last five years, but one of them was unpaid, so it doesn't count (= cannot be considered as a real job).
example.egtrans: 过去5年中我干过3份工作，但其中有1份没有薪水，因此不能算。

example.eg: I've always counted Sophia among my closest friends.
example.egtrans: 我一直把索非亚当作我最知心的朋友之一。

example.eg: I didn't think his grudging remarks really counted as an apology.
example.egtrans: 我觉得他那些勉强说出的话不能算是真正的道歉。

name: count
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of counting, or the total number of things counted

example.eg: Having done a quick count, I find I've planted 25 different ferns.
example.egtrans: 很快地数了下，我发现自己已经种了 25 种不同的蕨类植物。

example.eg: The current head count (= total number of people) is about 31,500 employees.
example.egtrans: 目前的清点人数约为 31,500 名员工。

example.eg: We had 450 members at the last count (= when they were last counted).
example.egtrans: 根据最新统计，我们有450位成员。

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of counting the votes in an election, or the event when this happens

example.eg: Early counts show Mr Adams in the lead.
example.egtrans: 早先的计票显示亚当斯先生领先。

example.eg: The candidate's spouse and election agent are also entitled to be present at the count.
example.egtrans: 候选人的配偶和选举代理人也有权在计票时出席。

example.eg: He lost by 3% of the vote, and has challenged the count in court.
example.egtrans: 他以3%的票数落败，并已在法庭上对计票提出质疑。

trans_examp.trans_en: a scientifically measured amount of something

example.eg: a high pollen count
example.egtrans: 高花粉数量

example.eg: a low blood/sperm count
example.egtrans: 低血细胞／精子数量

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to record how many of something there are, or how many times something has happened
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 记录（数量或发生的次数）

example.eg: So many people asked us for help, it was hard to keep count.
example.egtrans: 太多人请求我们帮助了，很难记录准确的数字。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not be able to remember how many times something has happened

example.eg: I've lost count of how many times she's been late for work this month.
example.egtrans: 我已记不清她这个月迟到多少次了。

phrase.phrase_title: on the count of three, four, five, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: when a particular number is reached

example.eg: On the count of three, I'd like you all to stand up.
example.egtrans: 我数到3时希望你们全都起立。

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a European man of the same social rank as an English earl

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular crime that a person is accused of

example.eg: The prisoner was found guilty on two counts of murder.
example.egtrans: 该囚犯被判定犯有两宗谋杀罪。

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an opinion in a discussion or argument

example.eg: I'm afraid I disagree with you on all/several counts (= I disagree with all/several of your opinions).
example.egtrans: 恐怕我完全不能同意你的看法／恐怕我不能同意你的几点看法。
